IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Improve quality of life through early childhood education, health and social services
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Organization is organized to provide social services to families located in the near southside of Chicago. The mission is to improve the quality of life to culturally and economically diverse families by providing early childhood, health and socially services.
IRS990.Desc: Henry Booth House provides services to over 4,000 families in Chicago and is the second largest provider of Head Start services in Chicago. Core programs include a comprehensive child development program tailored to meet the cognitive, social, emotional and physical needs of 3-5 year old children. Pre-School All - Supplemental funding focused on achieving school readiness for the most at risk children.Child Care Collaboration - allows a child a full day of educational supports enabling the parents to attend school or work.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Family Health Center program provides prenatal medical services to expectant mothers and their families by providing pregnancy coaches to ensure at-risk women enjoy healthy pregnancies and deliveries. The focus is on families from pregnancy through the first year of life reducing low birth weight babies and infant mortality. The program strengthens families by promoting positive parent child interactions with an emphasis on health of the family. Additional focus is on educating and counseling families from pregnancy to 3 years of age with the goal of preventing child abuse. The Women, Infants and Children (WIC) program focuses on women who are pregnant and their child(ren) up to 5 yrs of age educating mothers on proper nutrition for babies and young children.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The permanently restricted endowment fund consists of two perpetual trusts held by third parties. The Organization receives annual payments from the endowment fund to be used for general operating expenses.

FIN 48 Note from the Audited Financial Statements HBH was granted an exemption from federal income taxes by the Internal Revenue Service pursuant to the provisions of Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3). HBH qualifies for the charitable contribution deduction under Section 170(b)(1)(A)(vi) and has been classified as an organization that is not a private foundation under Section 509(a)(1). The tax-exempt purpose of HBH and the nature in which it operates is described above. HBH continues to operate in compliance with its tax-exempt purpose. HBH's annual informational and income tax returns filed with the federal and state governments are subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service for three years after filing. HBH has adopted the requirements for accounting for uncertain tax positions and management has determined that the Organization was not required to record a liability related to uncertain tax position's as of June 30, 2018.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Star Kids Math & Science Academy INC

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 was initially reviewed by the President & CEO and the Interim Finance Manager prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each employee and board member is made aware of the conflict of interest policy and must annually execute a statement acknowledging any potential conflicts.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation of the President/CEO is reviewed and approved by the Board of Directors. Wage comparabilty data and budgetary concerns are considered when determining compensation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interet policy and financial statements available upon request.
